    • Method Detail

      • kerberosAuthentication

        public KerberosAppSession kerberosAuthentication()
                                          throws java.io.IOException,
                                                 ResponseDecryptionException,
                                                 ApplicationDetailServiceUninitializedException,
                                                 RestClientException
        Description copied from interface: IKerberosAuthenticationClient
        This method checks for Application Authentication using the Kerberos Protocol. Uses the ApplicationDetailService class to fetch the Application registration information i.e. the Login name and Password. These information are used to get a TGT. This retrieve TGT is stored in the model TGT. If the authentication is successful creates a KerberosAppSession which could be retrieved from KerberosSessionManager getKerberosAppSession() method
        Specified by:
        kerberosAuthentication in interface IKerberosAuthenticationClient
        Returns:
        KerberosAppSession or null if the Authentication fails
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - In case there are some errors encountered while retrieving information
        ResponseDecryptionException - If the Application was unable to decrypt the Response sent by the server
        ApplicationDetailServiceUninitializedException - In case if the ApplicationDetailService has not been configured properly
        RestClientException - If the status of the response is not 200. The server side error message and error response code can be accessed using getMessage and getErrorCode methods respectively
